Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, fabric very fragile, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text, identifying contents and naming a man Pahu.
Curator's comments: Not identified, but could be: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 18, instead of 55674
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393131) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393131)
